Name: EU Artificial Intelligence Act (Regulation (EU) 2024/1689)
Status/Effective Dates: In force Aug 1, 2024; prohibited uses & AI literacy from Feb 2, 2025; GPAI obligations from Aug 2, 2025; most high‑risk obligations from Aug 2, 2026–2027
Core Requirements (very short): Risk tiers; provider QMS; technical docs; logging; transparency; CE marking; FRIA for deployers in public services; conformity assessment
Who it applies to: Providers, deployers, importers, distributors in EU market

Name: Framework Convention on AI, Human Rights, Democracy & Rule of Law
Core Requirements (very short): Requires lifecycle governance consistent with human rights, democracy, rule of law
Who it applies to: States that sign/ratify; applies via domestic law

Name: Colorado AI Act (SB24‑205)
Core Requirements (very short): Reasonable care; risk management; impact assessments; notice & disclosure; incident reporting re algorithmic discrimination

Name: Local Law 144 (Automated Employment Decision Tools)
Status/Effective Dates: Bias audit & notices required since 2023; enforcement ongoing
Core Requirements (very short): Annual independent bias audit; public summary; candidate notice; opt‑out for data collection
Who it applies to: Employers & agencies using AEDTs for NYC positions

Name: CCPA/CPRA ADMT, Risk Assessments & Cybersecurity Audits Regulations
Core Requirements (very short): Consumer rights & opt‑out for ADMT; risk assessments; annual cybersecurity audits

Name: LGPD Article 20 (Automated Decisions)
Core Requirements (very short): Right to explanation & human review of automated decisions

Name: Interim Measures for Generative AI Services
Core Requirements (very short): Safety, security, data governance, labeling, truthfulness; filings
Who it applies to: Providers of generative AI services to public in mainland China

Name: OMB M‑24‑10 – Advancing Governance, Innovation & Risk Mgmt for Agency Use of AI
Core Requirements (very short): Agency AI inventories; risk assessments; impact levels; safety guardrails for rights/safety‑impacting uses

Name: NIST AI RMF 1.0
Core Requirements (very short): Govern, Map, Measure, Manage; risk‑based controls & profiles

Name: NIST Generative AI Profile (AI RMF Companion)
Core Requirements (very short): Cross‑sector profile tailoring AI RMF 1.0 to GenAI risks

Name: FDA PCCP for AI‑enabled Devices
Core Requirements (very short): Predetermined Change Control Plans for AI/ML devices; lifecycle & marketing submission recommendations

Name: FTC enforcement & guidance on AI unfair/deceptive practices
Core Requirements (very short): Crackdown on deceptive AI claims, fake reviews, unfair data practices

Name: EEOC Technical Assistance on AI & Title VII
Core Requirements (very short): Employer use of AI must avoid disparate impact; auditing & vendor oversight

Name: OECD AI Principles (updated 2024)
Core Requirements (very short): Human‑centered values; transparency; robustness; accountability; policy recommendations

Name: Recommendation on the Ethics of AI
Core Requirements (very short): Human rights, human oversight, transparency, fairness

Name: Model AI Governance Framework (2019/2020)
Core Requirements (very short): Internal governance, human involvement, operations management, stakeholder comms

Name: Model AI Governance Framework for Generative AI (Final)
Core Requirements (very short): Nine dimensions incl. accountability, data, testing/assurance, content provenance, incident reporting

Name: MAS FEAT Principles
Core Requirements (very short): Fairness, Ethics, Accountability, Transparency for AI in finance

Name: ISO/IEC 42001:2023 — AI Management System (AIMS)
Core Requirements (very short): Management system requirements for governing AI (PDCA cycle)

Name: ISO/IEC 42006:2025 — Requirements for AIMS Certification Bodies
Core Requirements (very short): Rules for bodies auditing/certifying against 42001

Name: ISO/IEC 23894:2023 — AI Risk Management
Core Requirements (very short): Processes to identify, assess, treat, monitor AI risk (maps to ISO 31000)

Name: TR 24028:2020 — Trustworthiness in AI (overview)
Core Requirements (very short): Survey of trustworthiness topics & mitigations

Name: ISO/IEC 38507:2022 — Governance implications of AI
Core Requirements (very short): Board‑level governance guidance for AI use

Name: TS 6254:2025 — Explainability & Interpretability Objectives
Core Requirements (very short): Objectives & approaches for explainability across lifecycle

Name: SR 11‑7 / OCC 2011‑12 / FDIC FIL‑22‑2017 — Model Risk Management
Core Requirements (very short): Model development/use; independent validation; governance; effective challenge

Name: GDPR Art. 22 & Art. 35 DPIA
Core Requirements (very short): Rights re automated decisions; DPIA for high‑risk processing (including profiling)
